data.title: Search - Spawn EACCES

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Linux gentoo 4.4.39-gentoo
- no extensions (`~/.vscode`) and nuked `~/.config/Code`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Folder
2. Ctrl + Shift + F
3. type any phrase; hit Enter
4. **Warn** **spawn EACCES** pops up
5. No search results from the selected folder displayed

There is no spam in console apart from:

> bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell

data.title: Treat Script Tag Contents in HTML as JS
data.body:
**Bug**
Script contents in html are treated as typescript instead of javascript

**Fix**
Explicitly set the script kind to js

Fixes #25846

data.title: Treat <script> contents as JavaScript, not TypeScript
data.body:
You currently can write typescript code inside of html script tags:

```html
    <script>
        var a: number = 123;
    </script>
```

This is not a big problem since we don't surface many errors for inline js, but it may result in inconsistencies

data.title: Incorrect 'cut' behavior (and delay?).
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.3|
|Angular-BeastCode|Mikael|4.1.6|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.15.1|
|regex|chrmarti|0.0.8|
|docthis|joelday|0.4.4|
|vscode-extension-auto-import|moppitz|1.3.3|
|vscode-versionlens|pflannery|0.13.0|;


---

There is a delay after 'cutting' some selected text that allows the user to reposition the cursor. This results in the original selected text being copied to the clipboard, but the line where the cursor is now positioned gets removed.

I have not tested this on any other environment.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select some text.
2. Right click on the text (or otherwise open the context menu)
3. Click 'Cut'
4. Immediately click somewhere in the editor text area (or press an arrow key)
5. Observe that the line the cursor moved to in step 4 is removed, but the original selected text (in step 1) is copied to the clipboard.

data.title: TypeScript May 2017 UX Issue Prioritization
data.body:
Tracks upstream TypeScript issues that are either commonly reported or could significantly improve the JS/TS experience in VSCode. The initial list tracks issues that we would like to look into for May. This is not a commitment that these issues will be fixed in May or even in TS 2.4.  Some of these items are also investigations. 

**Issues**
Somewhat ordered by priority

- Use correct quote style for `add missing import` quick fix https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/13270 

- IntelliSense for inherited properties: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7158

- Improve IntelliSense for imports https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/5515, https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/11099

- Correct error location for config file diagnostics - https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/10384

- Go to implementation for JS implementations (investigation) - https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/6209

**Active PRs**
https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/13921/files

// cc @kieferrm

data.title: Feature Request: MacOS Force Touch integration
data.body: It would be nice if we could integrate [force touch](https://developer.apple.com/macos/force-touch/) to show "Peek Definition" instead of default dictionary.

data.title: "Generate Theme" json process confused by newlines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (0834f15e86ef8359da9fbcf95d49083001af65c3, 2017-05-03T14:40:42.053Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.3|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.7.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.14.1|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.15.1|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.2.3|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|11.1.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.3.0|
|angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.17|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.12.0|
|project-snippets|rebornix|0.5.0|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|1.15.0|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using a syntax theme where the tmTheme XML file used newlines to organize keys, such as 

````
       <dict>
                <key>name</key>
                <string>Classes</string>
                <key>scope</key>
                <string>
                  support.class, 
                  entity.name.class, 
                  entity.name.type.class, 
                  meta.class
                </string>
                <key>settings</key>
                <dict>
                    <key>foreground</key>
                    <string>#C7AF3F</string>
                </dict>
            </dict>
````

Run the new "convert current settings to theme" command

2. Theme is created, but all those newlines and indents are preserved in the new json:

![screen shot 2017-05-03 at 8 17 38 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/25671728/0686a2c2-2fff-11e7-95bc-2ad1e5e72947.png)

data.title: Extensions: An `official` way to query for the current workspace SCM provider

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hello! For the [Better Merge](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=pprice.better-merge) extension I'd love to support other SCM providers and the merge conflict formats they produce, ideally i'd like to to be "automatic" without the user choosing what format to use. 

Looking at the new SCM interfaces there is no documented way of fetching the active SCM provider, although it appears to be available in undocumented properties (namely `vscode.scm.activeSourceControl`) - it would be awesome if this could be an official API, or some equivalent to achieve auto picking of merge formats. 

Beyond this, being able to get rich SCM information in an official way (e.g. conflict regions in files) would be  awesome.

data.title: No intellisense for Javascript project files that use 'require'
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.11.2 - OS Version: 10.11.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create project with A.js and B.js. Add a global variable or function and any 'require' statement to B.js 2. Attempt to access B's global variable from A.js (no intellisense shows). 3. Comment out the 'require' statement in B.js. 4. Attempt to access the global variable from A.js (intellisense shows).

data.title: Updating from 1.9.1 to 1.11.2
data.body:
Following this: [@code reply](https://twitter.com/code/status/859554783228604416)

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 / 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64 [6.1.7600]

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the following extensions:

- **IntelliSense for CSS class names**
- **file-icons**
- **gitignore**
- **Debugger for Chrome**

2. Update from VSCode 1.9.1 directly to 1.11.2 via the notification on the top.

3. [Bugs I noticed]: 

- **file-icons** not only become disabled but they vanish and must be reinstalled.
- **IntelliSense for CSS class names** doesn't recommend any class after typing _class="_.
- **gitignore** doesn't add any path to the gitignore file.

data.title: Allow to configure how to increase file name suffix
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Window 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a file like test_1.txt
2. copy and paste

In the previous version, the new file will have a name of test_2.txt but in this version, the file name will be test_1.1.txt. Is there any way to change it back to previous strategy of naming new files? Thanks.

data.title: FeatureRequest: Using the immediate window without building
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 14.0.24720.00 Update 1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I want to run simple commands in the immediate window without building the solution.  For example I might want to type something like "Double.Parse("0.1")"; but currently I will get the error "Build Failed. For a list of build errors see the Error List. For detailed information about a build error select an item and press F1.".

data.title: FreatureRequest: Select and copy text from the "About Microsoft Visual Studio" box
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  14.0.24720.00 Update 1
- OS Version: Windows 10

What I want to be able to do:

1.  Click on help
2.  Click on "About Microsoft Visual Studio"
3.  Various text is displayed, for example the text "version number: 14.0.24720.00 Update 1" is displayed.  I want to be able to select this text and copy it.

data.title: Code using 99%-100% CPU and doesn't allow me to do anything (cursor still blinking slowly) - Not frozen or crashed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.2|;
^^^ Not using - just installed

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use while building a react app
2. Use NPM to deploy and test/debug the app on
3. View the app in the latest version of IE with the developer console
4. Work for about 2-4 hours

Code uses 99%-100% of the CPU on my VM and won't allow me to save anything or close Code. This has happened 4 times over the passed 2 days of heavily using Code.

There seems to be two processes using 49.8% and 39.6% - sometimes force closing one will change it into an IE process. Not sure if this is IE developer console not playing nice with Code or what.

I've just noticed that there is an autosave of files that are not saved. It's great ! But there is something that i miss : an autosave for the language selected ! data.title: VS Code Does Not Reopen in the Same State
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

I seem to be having issues with "Each time you start VS Code, it opens up in the same state it was in when you last closed it. The folder, layout, and opened files are preserved." Everytime I close my workspace and reopen it the workspace is blank and I find myself having to drag and drop the files in my workspace again to set it the way I want it.  Does anyone else seem to be having this issue?  If so is there a solution around this?  I can't seem to find any potential settings to set in user or workspace to fix this issue.

2. Type git + [space]

I am not seeing any options to checkout or create a branch. In the documentation it says that I should be able to do so through the quick open.

data.title: Filter folders for formatOnSave
data.body:
We run a bigger project where we've recently added prettier and are using the `formatOnSave` option. However, we don't want to run the formatting process on files that are not part of a few directories.

Is it possible to add another option so I can configure a regex that will be tested against the filename before `formatOnSave` will be triggered? A glob would work as well.

data.title: Make VS Code compatible with windows VSS
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: windows 10 creators update

As per the logs of my backup software (Crashplan), I became aware that VSCode is one of the only 2 apps on my main PC that does not seem to be compatible with [windows VSS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb968832(v=vs.85).aspx), as its cache files cannot be backed up while running, unlike all other apps.

The files that cannot be backed up are, ATM:

````
\MyApps\vscode\data\Cache\data_0
\MyApps\vscode\data\Cache\data_1
\MyApps\vscode\data\Cache\data_2
\MyApps\vscode\data\Cache\data_3
\MyApps\vscode\data\GPUCache\data_1
````

Can VSCode be made compatible with VSS? 

Rgds

data.title: Working Tree sometimes doesn't show changes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)

|Align|steve8708|0.2.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open your file 
2. Make changes
3. Go to the Source Control
4. Double click on the file under changes
5. Blanks screen is shown

Upon switching files and following the same steps above the changes are shown.

data.title: Debugger leaves Mocha running forever with Inspector protocol
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a launch.json that launches mocha
```json
  "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
  "protocol": "inspector"
```
2. Run tests

After tests are finished, debugger doesn't exit (status bar stays orange)

data.title: top stack frame column heuristic should not look at stack frame column

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

- start to debug this code `[1, 2, 3].map(x => x * 2).filter(x => x > 3);`
- set breakpoint in arrow function
- press continue three times

Observe: the breakpoint in the arrow function is only hit once.

I've verified that the DAP returns the proper column location in the top stackframe.
